document_data.name: ''Canticle of Gauntlgrym''
document_data.mainbody:
The '''''Canticle of Gauntlgrym''''' was a song passed down among the [[dwarf|dwarves]] of [[the North]] in the generations prior to the reclamation of [[Gauntlgrym]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]], after which it served as an anthem of that city. {{quote|[[Silver]] halls and [[mithral]] doors
Stone walls to seal the cavern
Grander sights than e'er before
In smithy, mine, and tavern

Toil hard in endless night
In toast, oh, lift yer [[flagon]]!
Ye'll need the drink to keep ye right
At forge that bakes the [[dragon]].

Come [[Delzoun]], come one and all!
Rush to grab yer kin
And tell 'em that their home awaits
In grandest Gauntlgrym!|From the ''Canticle of Gauntlgrym''}}
document_data.History:
The ''Canticle'' was believed to have been composed in Gauntlgrym shortly after its original founding. For centuries after the city's fall, it was said that every dwarf in the North knew the song, and it held special significance for those who traced their lineage to Delzoun.

As of the {{YearlinkName|1489}}, this ancient song could often be heard among dwarves traveling to Gauntlgrym to make a new life there.
